channel.title: math.SP updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SP updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Eigenvalue Number and Location for Two-Particle Schr\"odinger Operators on $\mathbb{Z}^3$
item.description: arXiv:2511.14321v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We investigate a family of lattice Schr\"odinger operators \( H_{\mu_1 \mu_2}(K) \) describing a system of two identical bosons on the three-dimensional cubic lattice \( \mathbb{Z}^3 \), where \( K \in \mathbb{T}^3 \) denotes the quasi-momentum, and \( \mu_1, \mu_2 \in \mathbb{R} \) are coupling parameters associated with on-site and nearest-neighbour interactions, respectively. It is shown that the space \( L^{2,\mathrm{e}}(\mathbb{T}^3) \) admits a decomposition into three mutually orthogonal subspaces, each invariant under the operator \( H_{\mu_1 \mu_2}(0) \). A detailed spectral analysis of the restrictions of \( H_{\mu_1 \mu_2}(0) \) to one of these subspaces demonstrates that the parameter plane \( \mathbb{R}^2 \) contains two smooth critical curves dividing it into regions where the number of eigenvalues lying below the essential spectrum remains constant. Moreover, for the restrictions of $ H_{\mu_1 \mu_2}(0)$ to the other two invariant subspaces, which are unitarly equivalent to each other, a critical point is found on the $\mu_2$-axis. This point separate the axis into two intervals, within each of which the number of eigenvalues below the essential spectrum remains constant.
item.dc:creator: Saidakhmat N. Lakaev, Saidakbar S. Abduvayitov, Shuhrat S. Lakaev

item.title: CLT for the trace functional of the IDS of magnetic random Schr\"{o}dinger operator
item.description: arXiv:2511.14448v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We consider the existence of the integrated density of states (IDS) of the magnetic Schr\"{o}dinger operator with a random potential on the Hilbert space \( L^2(\mathbb{R}^d) \), as an analogue of the law of large numbers (LLN) for a trace functional. In this work, we establish an analogue of the central limit theorem (CLT), which describes the fluctuations of the trace functionals of the IDS, for a class of test functions denoted by \( C^1_{d,0}(\mathbb{R}) \). This class consists of real-valued, continuously differentiable functions on \( \mathbb{R} \) that decay at the rate \( O(|x|^{-m}) \) as \( |x| \to \infty \), where \( m > d + 1 \).
item.dc:creator: Dhriti Ranjan Dolai, Naveen Kumar

item.title: Two Koopman semigroups on discrete Lebesgue spaces
item.description: arXiv:2511.13868v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper we are interested to connect Koopman semigroups in Lebesgue funcion spaces $L^p(\R^+)$ and $C_0$-semigroups in Lebesgue sequence spaces $\ell^p$ for $1\le p < \infty$. To get this we use certain Poisson transformation ${\P}: L^p(\mathbb{R}^+)\to \ell^p$ and its adjoint ${\P}^*$ which allows carry semigroup properties from one space to the other one. Two Koopman semigroups on $\ell^p$ are presented and linked to the standard Koopman semigroup $T_p(t)f(r):= e^{-{t\over p}}f(e^{-t}r)$ and $S_{p}(t)f(r):= e^{-t\over p}f(e^{-t}r+1-e^{-t})$ for $t,r>0$ on $L^p(\R^+)$. In the last section we introduce Ces\`aro-like operators subordinated to these Koopman semigroups on $\ell^p$.
item.dc:creator: Pedro J. Miana

item.title: First Laplace eigenvalue of strongly isotropy irreducible spaces
item.description: arXiv:2511.14463v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study the smallest positive eigenvalue $\lambda_1$ of the Laplace-Beltrami operator associated with any compact strongly isotropy irreducible space. We provide an explicit expression for all simply connected cases. Furthermore, every strongly isotropy irreducible space is automatically an Einstein manifold, and we prove for each of them that $E<\lambda_1\leq 16E$, where $E$ denotes the corresponding Einstein constant.
item.dc:creator: Emilio A. Lauret, Fiorela Rossi Bertone, Alejandro Tolcachier

item.title: Dynamical Sampling: A Survey
item.description: arXiv:2511.10769v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Dynamical sampling refers to a class of problems in which space-time samples are taken from a signal evolving under an underlying dynamical system. The goal is to use these samples to recover relevant information about the system, such as the initial state, the evolution operator, or the sources and sinks driving the dynamics. These problems are tightly connected to frame theory, operator theory, functional analysis, and other foundational areas of mathematics; they also give rise to new theoretical questions and have applications across engineering and the sciences. This survey provides an overview of the theoretical underpinnings of dynamical sampling, summarizes recent results, and outlines directions for future work, including open problems and conjectures.
item.dc:creator: Akram Aldroubi, Carlos Cabrelli, Ilya Krishtal, Ursula Molter
